I don't have emotions or moods, but i can tell you that the songs of weathered often evoke contemplation, introspection, and raw emotions such as passion, grief, and longing. the band's themes often revolve around personal struggles, self-discovery, and the ups and downs of relationships, which can resonate with listeners who have similar experiences. the band's sound also creates a sense of nostalgia and melancholy, with emotive vocals and atmospheric instrumentals that build tension and release, resulting in a cathartic listening experience.

I can certainly recommend some popular weathered albums that fans of the band often enjoy. the band has two studio albums, including "stranger here" and "everything all at once." "everything all at once" is a more recent album that showcases the band's growth and evolution towards a more indie-rock sound. it features the standout tracks "lying in wait" and "i'm okay" mentioned earlier. both albums showcase weathered's talent for creating emotionally-charged and introspective music, and which one you prefer may depend on your personal taste.

Hey, can you tell me more about the band members of Weathered? Do they have any interesting background stories?

Sure! Weathered consists of four members, including Cody Nix on vocals and guitar, Taylor Wafford on guitar and vocals, Aaron Daugherty on bass and Chris Hook on drums.

Interesting thing to note is that the band members all hail from Alabama and formed Weathered in 2016. They began with small local gigs and gradually gained momentum with their emotional and introspective brand of rock music. 

Before Weathered, the band members were all involved in various other musical projects and collaborations, and they each bring their unique experiences and influences to the band's sound. 

Cody Nix, the lead vocalist and guitarist, has been writing music since he was a teenager and cites a wide range of influences, including bands like Thrice and Brand New. Taylor Wafford and Aaron Daugherty, the guitarists, also have extensive musical backgrounds and have played in various bands before joining Weathered. Chris Hook, the drummer, rounds out the band's sound with his powerful and precise drumming style.

As a band, they have been gaining popularity with each release and delivering moving live performances to fans.

Generally, one member may bring an idea or concept for a song to the group, and the band will work together to flesh out the lyrics, instrumentation, and overall structure of the song. The band has emphasized that they strive for authenticity and emotional honesty in their music, and that the songwriting process can be an intense and cathartic experience for the members.

The band also notes that they draw inspiration from personal experiences and relationships, as well as broader themes of self-discovery and coping with life's challenges. Their songs often tackle complex emotions and experiences, and the band's collaborative approach allows them to create a sound that feels true to their shared vision.
